column2: et pòpuli meditáti sunt inánia~? ^ Why have the Gentiles raged
column3: and the people devised vain things~?

column2: et príncipes convenérunt in unum advèrsus Dòminum
column3: et advèrsus christum ejus. ^ The kings of the earth stood up

column2: et projiciámus a nobîs jugum ipsórum.~»^ "Let us break their bonds asunder
column3: and let us cast away their yoke from us."

column1: 4 ^ Qŭi hábitat in caĕlîs irridébit eos
column2: et Dòminus subsannábit eos. ^ He that dwelleth in heaven shall laugh at them
column3: and the Lord shall deride them.

column1: 5 ^ Tunc loqŭétur ad eos in ira sua
column2: et in furóre suo conturbábit eos. ^ Then shall he speak to them in his anger
column3: and trouble them in his rage.

column1: 6 ^ «~Ego aŭtem constitútus sum rex ab eo super Siónem
column3: práĕdicans praĕcèptum ejus.~»^ "But I am appointed king by him over Sion
ego hódie ģènui te. ^ The Lord hath said to me
column5: this day have I begotten thee.

column2: et dabo tìbi ģèntes hereditátem tuam
column3: et possessiónem tuam tèrminos terraĕ. ^ Ask of me
column4: and I will give thee the Gentiles for thy inheritance
column5: and the utmost parts of the earth for thy possession.

column2: et tamqŭam vas fìguli confrìnģes eos.~»^ Thou shalt rule them with a rod of iron
column3: and shalt break them in pieces like a potter's vessel."

column2: et exsultáte ei cum tremóre. ^ Serve ye the Lord with fear
column3: and rejoice unto him with trembling.
et periátis de via justa. ^ Embrace discipline
column4: lest at any time the Lord be angry
column5: and you perish from the just way.

column1: 13 ^ Qŭum exárserit in brèvi ira ejus
column2: beáti òmnes qŭi confídunt in eo. ^ When his wrath shall be kindled in a short time
column3: blessed are all they that trust in him.
